conclusion: The EMF (ε) induced in a coil is given by Faraday's Law of Electromagnetic Induction: ε = -m φ/dt, where m is the number of turns of the coil and φ is the magnetic flux through one turn of the coil.
From Figure (Z), the magnetic flux φ varies sinusoidally with time t.
The general form of sinusoidal variation is φ(t) = φ_max sin(ωt), where φ_max is the maximum magnetic flux and ω is the angular frequency.
The period T of the sinusoidal variation can be determined from the graph. The time for one complete cycle (from 0 to 2π) is approximately 6.28 × 10^{-2} seconds.
The angular frequency ω is ω = 2π/T = 100π rad/s.
The rate of change of magnetic flux dφ/dt is φ_max ω cos(ωt).

premise: The maximum value of dφ/dt occurs when cos(ωt) = 1.

conclusion: The maximum EMF is ε_max = m φ_max ω

premise: ε_max = m φ_max ω, m = 100, φ_max = 2.0 × 10^{-2} Wb, ω = 100π
